intro: Mikania globosa, commonly known as globe morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a vine that produces small, globe-shaped flowers, typically ranging from white to purple in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is often found in moist, sunny environments. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes other flowering plants with similar climbing habits. Mikania globosa is known for its rapid growth and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
